poem:
### Odesa Dreams

The Vik(ing)tor sails  
past Odesa's stone breath,  
a whisper of restless tides,  
where shadows of history  
sway along the quay—  
independence murmurs  
to the slumbering streets,  
the Black Sea's embrace  
carrying tales of love,  
of war's tender siege.  
In each ripple, a city  
undefeated, awakes.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Undefeatable: Odesa in Love & War by Julian Evans review – a ‘sleeping beauty’ now besieged In 1994 the writer Julian Evans went on a 10-day cruise down the Dnipro River. Ukraine had won its independence three years before. The journey took Evans along an ancient route used by the “restless Vikings” who established Kyiv. His ship – the Viktor Glushkov – stopped off at Crimea and Yalta. Its final destination was the glittering Black". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

His ship – the Viktor Glushkov – stopped off at Crimea and Yalta. Its final destination was the glittering Black
